qas.question: How many restaurants in the western style were present in Kathmandu circa 1955?
What chain restaurants are present in Kathmandu?
How is the egg in American chop suey prepared?
Along with locals and tourists, who eats at Kathmandu's restaurants?
Along with Nepali, Indian and Chinese cuisines, what cuisine has been a focus of Kathmandu restaurants?

context: Kathmandu had only <a0_0>one<a0_0/> western-style restaurant in 1955. A large number of restaurants in Kathmandu have since opened, catering Nepali cuisine, <a4_0>Tibetan<a4_0/> cuisine, Chinese cuisine and Indian cuisine in particular. Many other restaurants have opened to accommodate locals, <a3_0>expatriates<a3_0/>, and tourists. The growth of tourism in Kathmandu has led to culinary creativity and the development of hybrid foods to accommodate for tourists such as American chop suey, which is a sweet-and-sour sauce with crispy noodles with a <a2_0>fried<a2_0/> egg commonly added on top and other westernized adaptations of traditional cuisine. Continental cuisine can be found in selected places. International chain restaurants are rare, but some outlets of <a1_0>Pizza Hut and KFC<a1_0/> have recently opened there. It also has several outlets of the international ice-cream chain Baskin-Robbins
